text: Wow that NCS programme sounds really interesting!
Sounds like you did really well in it too! Nice job!
I think you should always do what you enjoy and if you do that the likelihood is that will lead to career options you like too
Obviously if you want to become a doctor or something there are certain things you will have to do but other than that I’d do what you enjoy
If you’re considering clinical psychology it sounds like it might be a subject you’re quite interested in then!

Definitely have some good interview tips:
Dress smart and appear organised and prepared
Do lots of prep thinking about what the employer will want to hear, what they are looking for, think of examples in your life where you can demonstrate that behaviour
If they ask you a question like ‘can you tell us about a time when...’ then try to answer using the STAR format (situation, task, action, result). So you explain the situation you were in, what the problem was you had to solve or what you were asked to do, explain what you did and why you did it then explain the result and what you might have done different next time to show you learnt from a situation

Also if they ask you about anything that you don’t have direct experience of don’t worry just try to think of a similar example and use that. For example I once did an interview and they asked me about writing business cases which I hadn’t done before but I said I had written reports at work and my dissertation which all demonstrated I was capable of writing at that level - if that makes ends
